alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Pike County through 315 PM EDT... At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over Moree, or near Threeforks, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph. Strong wind gusts have out run the main area of thunderstorms and will impact locations ahead of the thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Forest Hills and Belfry around 255 PM EDT. Hardy, Huddy and Mcandrews around 300 PM EDT. Board Tree, Phelps, Jamboree and Coleman around 310 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Woodman, Majestic and Argo. THIS INCLUDES U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 6 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
